benchmark_details.name: WorldView-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: WorldView-Bench is a benchmark designed to evaluate Global Cultural Inclusivity (GCI) in Large Language Models (LLMs) by analyzing their ability to accommodate diverse worldviews through free-form generative evaluation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to assess cultural inclusivity biases in Large Language Models (LLMs) through open-ended questions that require generators to produce culturally diverse responses.

data.source: OpenAI's o1 model generated and human-validated questions.
data.annotation: Questions were validated through a multi-stage pipeline involving automated and human validation.

methodology.calculation: PDS measures the representational share of cultural perspectives extracted from LLM responses.
methodology.interpretation: Higher PDS and entropy values indicate greater cultural inclusivity in LLM outputs.
methodology.validation: Three-stage validation process involving automated generation, LLM-assisted evaluation, and final human validation.
